tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=40, embedded=0, frontend=14}
items.content:
Senior WordPress Developer at AdTaxi Networks

Remote

Job Locations: US-CO-Denver

Requisition ID: 2019-2174

Time Type: Full-Time

Employment Type: Regular

Overview

We want to be the best. That’s why we hire the best. As the 2018 winner of Digiday’s Worklife Award for Most Passionate Employees at an Agency, we thrive on challenging, rewarding, purpose-driven work. We’re looking for skilled individuals like you – for professionals full of talent, but not of themselves.

Adtaxi is a client-centric digital organization that brings scale, precision, and sophistication to digital marketing. Leveraging the belief that people matter as much as technology, we help advertisers solve complex marketing challenges with custom, performance-driven solutions.

We are a Facebook Small Business Solutions Partner, a Google Premier Partner, and the recipient of the 2016 Google Channel Sales Innovator Award – US; this prestigious award, the only one in the innovation category presented to a U.S. company, recognizes the leading-edge technology of our Quantum Optimization Platform.

Responsibilities

The MNG Digital Product & Development team is leading the company’s digital transformation through strategic new initiatives focused on how news content gets distributed, how communities engage with DFM news properties, and how revenue is generated in an industry undergoing rapid change.

We are seeking a strong, highly creative WordPress Developer to be part of the team as we continue to create new news sites and advanced features on our in-house built WordPress VIP content management system. This person will be intellectually curious, eager to learn about news media and how technology can help chart its future course, and, in general, through collaboration and participation with other developers, product managers, and others, improve the organization as a whole.

Specifically, the Developer will:

  • Be ready, willing, and able to think through complex problems, help fix them, mentor and support others, think outside the box and ask questions.
  • Have strong experience and understanding in PHP, the WordPress Framework and WordPress REST API.
  • Have a minimum understanding of all of the following, and be able to demonstrate working knowledge in most of it:
  1. Object Oriented Programming
  2. Software design patterns
  3. JavaScript
  4. React/Redux
  5. Experience with GraphQL helpful
  6. MYSQL
  7. PHP
  8. NOSQL
  9. CSS3
  10. HTML5
  11. REST Services
  12. GIT Version Control
  13. Command Line $BASH etc.
  14. Web server technology – Apache, NGINX or similar
  15. Experience with Document Object Model (DOM) and Regex helpful
  • Work closely with a team of product and development experts to ideate, design, and develop a variety of next generation news and advertising products
  • Resolve site issues and oversee testing associated with maintenance and measuring success metrics
  • Carry out other duties as may be assigned or requested

Qualifications

  • Has a minimum of 3 to 5 years of experience in the field or in a related area
  • Detail oriented, well organized, able to thrive in deadline driven environment while working on a number of projects simultaneously and independently.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Experience with consumer-facing web sites and user experience.
  • Proven expertise in third-party integrations.
  • Experience working in an Agile environment helpful, but not required.
  • Experience with Chrome/Firefox debugger and development tools helpful.
  • Grow expertise by proactively remaining current with trends within digital media technologies.

Additional information:

This is a full-time, salaried position, W-2 only (no corp to corp). Position based in Denver, CO, but will consider remote applicants on a case by case basis.

Apply for job

items.title: RELAYTO Developer Internprenuer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=13, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
WHAT IS RELAYTO/?


RELAYTO/ is the first publishing tool for interactive documents. It revolutionizes how any individual or organization creates and shares knowledge with their audience, and measures impact. It gives you simple, slick, and smart features to communicate with your colleagues, prospects, and customers. Think Squarespace for documents - proposals, presentations, reports, emails and more - no design or coding needed.


Check out some of the reasons we think it's a game-changer for professionals and businesses.


AM I A GOOD FIT?
You are not an average intern looking to claw your way to middle management at a bank for the next 10 years. You are an internpreneur: a hacker or designer, journalist or marketer, idea person or data quant, MBA candidate with years of experience or university student looking for their first gig.


An internpreneur approaches their career like an entrepreneur: able and eager to get things done and innovate with limited resources. You think ahead and want to learn how companies and careers grow before jumping in the deep end of the entrepreneurial/career pool entirely on your own. What else?



  • You are able to execute in startup time and independently figure out things that are entirely new

  • You believe business can make the world a better place (while keeping an eye on the bottom line)

  • You want to improve the business world - and yourself

  • You have experience in one or more of the following technologies: Javascript / PHP / MongoDB

  • Willingness to learn one or more of the following technologies: Angular.js / Symfony2 / Docker



WHAT CAN RELAYTO/ DO FOR ME?


Re-think grad school: gain an education, experience, and amazing connections.


If you're not ready to launch your own venture or don't quite know who you want to be professionally, we are a great foundation. Get in on the ground floor of an awesome and innovative company.


If you are curious about the specific role - reach out to us. But broadly speaking, the range of opportunities and responsibilities include:



  • Define customer needs and usability specs. Be the champion of our users

  • Craft breakthrough designs and architecture

  • Build solutions. Find and create best practices templates for key activities in computer science, UI/UX, user feedback, etc.

  • Build and test new product prototypes. Get instant feedback

  • Depending on your professional goals and RELAYTO's needs, this internship would be designed to balance your learning with specific business requirements


WHY GET EXCITED?



  • A big vision product that’ll improve how people and groups create, communicate and work together, with potential appeal to everyone who wants to share knowledge or learn.

  • An experienced, proven team that has previously built and sold the largest business applications in the cloud and on the desktop.

  • Exciting product challenges, in both architecture, product management and user experience.

  • A team that gives the opportunity to young talent and values the diversity of experience and perspective.

  • A driven set of individuals that genuinely enjoy working with one another: solving problems; refining designs; creating, learning and growing together.

  • A jerk-free culture defined by trust, respect, and empathy.

  • A company that’s advised by some of the smartest experts in the business.


WHERE AND WHEN?


Meet us in some of the coolest cities in the world or work remotely.


We are a location-free startup, currently spanning London, Paris, Johannesburg & San Francisco. We encourage flexibility and opportunity for working virtually or in physical teams, depending on your preference. The primary location for in-person meetings will be San Francisco, London and Paris.


We require at least a 20 hours/week commitment from interns working remotely during the school year.

items.content:
Backend Drupal Developer (Zürich or Remote CET)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Web Design, Web Development, Web Hosting
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Amazee | Zürich, Switzerland

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Amsterdam +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Zürich, Switzerland. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

drupal
graphql
php
mysql
drupal-8

Job description

We are currently looking for an experienced Backend Drupal Developer to join our Zurich team. As part of the Amazee Labs team, you will be building the underpinning for our ambitious client projects using modern web technologies. In addition to working with established tools like Drupal 8, you will be able to work and experiment with bleeding edge technologies like React, Vue.js or GraphQL. 

Responsibilities

  • Build, extend, and configure Drupal sites using core and contrib modules.
  • Engineer and develop backend solutions to meet client requirements.
  • Collaborate with other engineers and clients.

Requirements

  • Strong background in PHP, MySQL and JavaScript.
  • Extensive Drupal knowledge and experience.
  • Drupal 8 knowledge and experience.
  • Experience working collaboratively using version control (Git).
  • Proficient in English, both spoken and written.
  • An active player in the Open Source community (high level of commitment and contribution).

Plus

  • Knowledge of GraphQL (and Relay or Apollo).
  • Knowledge and experience with React or Vue.js
  • Experience in automated testing of JavaScript applications.
  • Node.js experience.
  • Experience with Webpack and other build tools.
  • Agile and Scrum experience.

Work Location

Our office in Zurich, or remote within the Central European time zone.

We offer

  • Exciting and challenging projects.
  • Biennial soft and hardware budget.
  • The opportunity to take one month off to do something extreme, after three years of full-time employment.
  • Attendance of DrupalCons and Camps. Annual education and fitness budgets.

If you are excited about the opportunity to join an international digital agency and think you will be a good fit, we would love to hear from you. Please send your CV, portfolio and a cover letter telling us about your work experience, as well as some interesting details about yourself. We are looking forward to meeting you!

Apply now

About Amazee

Amazee Labs is a leading global Drupal and React agency with a passion for engaging web design. Our services include web consulting, web development as well as hosting and maintenance. We excel in the areas of web design, user experience and high performing websites. We’re a young and dynamic team, working with international clients and companies of varying sizes and industries.

Benefits

  • Bi-annual soft and hardware budget
  • Attend Conferences and Camps
  • Annual education budget
  • Annual fitness budget
  • After three years you get one month off to do something extreme
  • Young and international team
  • Possibility to work remotely
  • Possibility to work from other Amazee Hubs

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=20, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
InnovateFromZero.com has a place for a Web Developer (part-time) with working knowledge of Wordpress CMS to develop new skills in web development, design optimisation, data-analytics & technical SEO. As a winner of multiple innovation awards, we help turn great concepts into great products for our clients and often build multiple landing pages as a part of the process.


InnovateFromZero was founded with a vision to help execute product development projects in web, mobile, and IoT. Amongst the founding partners are successful innovators from ex-Nokia, Google, etc.


The position is suited to students or recent graduates who want work experience in Web Development, enjoys designing landing pages, understands SEO and wants to learn more about data-driven development. You want to hone your skills in optimising Wordpress sites, learning about SEO and using Analytics for digital campaigns.


About You: You are self-motivated, likes clean code and want a fast-paced startup experience.


Your Role (needed): • Graduated or due to graduate with a degree in Engineering, IT or IT related subjects or demonstrated professional Development experience. • Wordpress development skills are mandatory


You will assist with:



  • Identify, troubleshoot, fix, and optimize websites for performance

  • Analyze reports to identify trends, issues, areas for opportunity and create actionable plans to improve KPI’s (with support from the team).


BONUS:



  • Good understanding of search performance, conversion, and online data analysis

  • Experience with Wordpress Yoast SEO plug-in

  • Some knowledge of Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and Google Search Console

  • Excellent HTML, CSS, and JavaScript skills


Data Skills:



  • Data analytics related skills incl use of Kaggle data-sets or kernels

  • Review, update and create high-quality datasets

  • Kernels and tutorials to showcase new features

  • Help onboard client or external partner data-sets

  • Ability to work with messy data and clean, munge, and wrangle it into standard formats using Python or R


Experience working with Data Analytics is not mandatory, but you are a quick learner who can pick up the basics. 


Your Role (preferred): • Some examples of former projects at school/ Uni where you built websites • While some skills can be learned at the job, healthy interest in technology, innovation is useful.


You must have a passion for web development.


To Apply: Send CV/ Letter and tell us why this is right for you! If you have an example of an SEO-optimised website performing well on speed test parameters, etc. you executed in work or uni (is a plus).


If selected you will be based out of our Glasgow city center office in a fantastic co-working environment (2-3 day a week internship, how often you like to come in is flexible, remote work will be OK in some cases).

items.content:
PHP Developer (multiple levels)

In the first 12 Months you will:

    • Help Hussle grow further by taking ownership of the development of our customer facing Website and Business facing websites using PHP/MySQL and Sass
    • You will work closely with the Product Support team to continuously improve the experience on both the eCommerce Website and Partners website.
    • Train and mentor more junior engineers in the team.
    • Write tests for your own code and increase test coverage for our applications.
    • Work with the rest of the team to improve code quality through refactoring and code reviews.
    • There will be the opportunity to be involved in further development of our AWS Infrastructure, DevOps culture and release procedures.
    • Work on big and small projects.
    • Show leadership as part of an inclusive, reciprocal engineering culture, where everyone wants to improve and ego’s are left at home.


Our customer facing and business websites are built on Zend Framework Using PHP, MySQL, Sass and React.js, all of this is hosted on AWS using RDS Aurora, EC2, Elasticache, S3 and Lambda built with CloudFormation.

We are looking for a developer who has extensive experience working with modern PHP frameworks (we are using Zend Framework), experience in Javascript and Javascript Frameworks (React Preferable) would be beneficial but not necessary to apply.

Feel free to apply even if you don’t have experience in all of the mentioned technologies, for instance we would also love to talk to people who have experience with other PHP frameworks such as Laravel or Symfony.

Apply now

items.title: Kanopi Studios: WordPress Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=1, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=45, embedded=0, frontend=16}
items.content:
WordPress Engineer

ABOUT OUR COMPANY

Kanopi Studios is a Design, Development & Support Agency with a fully distributed team of 45 people who are experts in WordPress & Drupal.

We design, build, and support websites for clients who want to make a positive impact.

All done with craftsmanship, a bit of whimsy, and the desire for a better web.

As our business continues to grow rapidly, so does our team. We’re excited to announce this opportunity to join our team as a WordPress Engineer.

ABOUT THE FOUNDER
Anne Stefanyk, CEO/Founder

It was the love of the open-source community and the direct need she saw for an agency focused around customer success that drove Anne to build Kanopi.

She envisioned Kanopi’s workplace to be a place where the clients and employees alike would feel connected and supported. A place where she could feel 100% confident that every detail of every project would be covered. She imagined a place where all who engaged with Kanopi would feel surprised and delighted by the day-to-day operations.

With that vision in mind, Kanopi Studios was born. Kanopi Studios is now a team of 45 people, where 95% of our business comes from word of mouth and referrals. Kanopi is about good work with good people creating a better web for everyone.

ABOUT THE JOB
As a WordPress Engineer your day-to-day includes working closely with your project managers and technical leads; responding to support tickets, running updates and doing site configuration; creating and maintaining custom themes, plugins, and documentation; and being a resource for your peers. You will be developing and maintaining sites while keeping yourself accountable to schedules, estimates, project requirements, and high standards of quality. This position is fast-paced, deals with shifting priorities, and reports to Katherine White, CTO.

Your typical work week might include:
  • Building and supporting a wide variety of WordPress sites.
  • Answering technical questions from others on the team.
  • Writing custom themes and plugins.
  • Working with git to commit your code regularly.
  • Communicating regularly with your team about task estimates and progress and identifying potential problems.
  • Using documented user stories, technical requirements, data models, and process flows in your development work.
  • Problem-solving, collaborating and asking questions proactively.
  • Fostering an atmosphere of mutual respect with your team and on your projects.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 3+ years of WordPress development experience or the equivalent.
  • Experience working within an agency environment and with remote teams.
  • Experience identifying and surfacing potential project issues.
  • Passion for the web and open source development.
  • Inclusive, supportive, and thoughtful interpersonal communication skills.
  • Experience with modern development tools and methods such as atomic and responsive design, gitflow, container-based environments, task runners, CSS preprocessors, IDEs, and CI/CD platforms
  • Awareness of performance, security, and Unix server administration.
  • Exposure to a variety of project management styles (waterfall, agile, scrum)
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related experience.

At Kanopi, we believe a variety of backgrounds, experiences, and voices make for a better workplace. We strongly and enthusiastically encourage people of color, individuals who identify within and beyond the LGBTQ+ spectrum, women, and people with disabilities to apply.

ABOUT THE COMPENSATION & WORK REQUIREMENTS
This position is full-time. Salary and compensation are commensurate with experience. Not to worry. The pay is competitive and what you’d expect for this role. This is a 100% remote role, but you must live and be able to work in North America.

NOW, WHAT?
If you think this post was written just for you, here’s what to do next:

  1. Submit your resume.
  2. Answer the questions you see here on this page.
  3. Send us a cover letter.

Now… About that cover letter… This is VERY important!

Please include all of the typical reasons why you’d be an outstanding candidate for this position, plus answer these two questions:

  1. Over the past year, what has been your most important achievement, either professional or personal?
  2. If you were a superhero (heck, maybe you already are!), what would be your superpower and why?

If we feel like you may well be the perfect candidate, we’ll contact you to set up a short phone screen to kick off the interview process. We’ll only contact those candidates that we feel are a good match. Sorry. That’s just the way it goes.

GOT QUESTIONS?
We've done our best to describe the company, our customers and the role. But hey, we're not perfect, so if anything here is unclear, include any questions you might have in your cover letter.

I think that's it.

If you're awesome, we want to hear from you!


BENEFITS

Fully Remote: Work where and when you do your best. It’s about feeling connected to others, having a flexible schedule and staying healthy.

Top Talent: Since we are not limited by walls, our ability to hire the best is limitless. Collaborate, learn and surround yourself with a strongly skilled and diverse team.

Travel: Love to see the world? So do we. Just find a place with good wifi, get connected and make great work happen!

This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by those assigned to this classification. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by those occupying this position. The job description and job functions described herein are subject to possible modification by Kanopi Studios in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

No agencies, recruiters or overseas applicants.

PS - Please don't judge us on our Divi WordPress site. Our lovely new site is launching in 2 weeks - ask for a link to check it out when you apply. Happy WordPressing!

items.content:
PHP-/Javascript-Entwickler mit einem Faible für Datenprozesse (w/m/d)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Consulting, Digital Agency, Email Marketing
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Publicare Marketing Communications GmbH | Frankfurt am Main, Deutschland

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin
Office Location: Frankfurt am Main, Deutschland. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

php
javascript
sql
rest

Job description

Chance für Entwickler, die sich entfalten wollen!
Du bist ein PHP-/Javascript-Entwickler, der sich gerne in den aktuellsten Frameworks bewegt, für den Entwicklung und Programmierung eine Berufung ist und der dabei noch über den Tellerrand hinausblickt. Bei uns erwarten Dich spannende Aufgaben und die Chance, durch clevere Lösungen und Qualität zu punkten – in Frankfurt am Main oder in Deinem Home-Office.

PHP-/Javascript-Entwickler mit einem Faible für Datenprozesse (w/m/d)
Bei uns findest Du viele sympathische Kolleginnen und Kollegen, die genauso denken wie Du. Einen Arbeitsplatz, der hervorragend ausgestattet ist und der in unserem Office in Frankfurt am Main oder gerne auch in Deinem Home-Office sein kann. Du willst weniger als 40 Stunden die Woche arbeiten? Mit unserer flexiblen Teilzeitgestaltung hast Du Arbeitszeiten, die sich an Deinen Lebensrhythmus anpassen. Lass uns einfach darüber reden, wie wir zusammenkommen!

Das tust Du!
Gemeinsam mit den Kollegen aus der Entwicklung beantwortest Du Kundenanforderungen, denkst Dich in den Workflow und die Prozesse unserer Kunden ein und unterstützt diese durch geeignete Applikationen – ohne lange Entscheidungsprozesse innerhalb der Organisation.

Die Entwicklung komplexer B2B-Anwendungen gehören zu Deinem Alltag, genauso wie Web-Formulare, Landing-Pages oder Microsites. Über die Entwicklung, das Testing bis zur Implementierung stellst Du sicher, dass Deine Projekte termin- und qualitätsgerecht live gehen – maßgeschneidert, userfreundlich und optimal auf den jeweiligen technischen Background abgestimmt.

Klar, dass Du die Schnittstellen zu den Kernsystemen unserer Kunden zuverlässig mitbedenken und auf User Experience, Responsive Design und Site Speed achtest.

Du bist stets über neue Entwicklungen und Trends bei Web-Technologien informiert und weißt, diese sinnvoll und effizient in Projekten nutzbar zu machen.

Das bist Du!
Du verfügst über Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Web-Applikationen auf Basis von modernen Frameworks wie Laravel und der Kenntnis gängiger Entwurfsmuster.

  • Mit den Frontend-Markup-Standards (HTML5, CSS3) sowie PHP 7 und SQL bist Du vertraut.
  • Unittest, PHPUnit & Codeception – Du denkst nur TDD, BDD & DDD.
  • REST, SOAP, ECMAScript & Vue.js – geht Dir leicht von der Hand.
  • Ein gutes Gespür für nutzerfreundliches Interface-Design hast Du auch.
  • Du beherrschst Englisch sicher in Wort und Schrift.
  • Dazu bist Du ein aufgeschlossener, kommunikativer Teamplayer.
Apply now

About Publicare Marketing Communications GmbH

Das sind wir
Es gibt Online-Marketing-Agenturen, die wickeln für Ihre Kunden Projekte ab. Und es gibt Publicare: seit 1994. Wir beraten ganzheitlich und zeigen neue Wege auf – strategisch, technisch und kreativ.

Am Ende steht immer eine passgenaue Plattform für unsere Kunden bereit, die wir aus einem großen Repertoire aus Bausteinen zusammensetzen. Je nach Zielsetzung entwickeln wir weitere Elemente oder integrieren große Cloud-Anwendungen bzw. die Systeme unserer Kunden. Namenhafte nationale und internationale Unternehmen wie eBay, Vodafone, mobile.de, Unitymedia, LIDL, toom, Alnatura und viele mehr vertrauen auf unsere Lösungen. Und künftig auch auf Dich! Denn Du wirst bei uns anspruchsvolle Web- und Portalprojekte realisieren und testen!

Das bieten wir Dir

  • Du bestimmst die Arbeitszeit – ob  dreiviertel oder ganztags – wir sind so flexibel wie Du.
  • Ein Top-ausgestatteter Arbeitsplatz in Frankfurt-Sachsenhausen oder in Deinem Home-Office.
  • Spannende Web-Projekte und die Chance, durch Deinen Input, clevere Lösungen und Qualität zu punkten.
  • Strukturiertes, eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten ohne lange Entscheidungsprozesse mit Freiraum für die berufliche Weiterentwicklung.
  • Guter Kaffee, frisches Obst, Kekse, ÖPNV-Ticket uvm.

Interessiert?
Rufe Robert Harnischmacher unter der 069 – 60 50 09 56 an, um darüber zu reden, wie wir zusammenkommen!

Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung an:
Publicare Marketing Communications GmbH
Städelstraße 10
60596 Frankfurt am Main
jobs[at]publicare.de

Benefits

  • Bis zu 100 % Homeoffice möglich!
  • Gewinnbeteiligung
  • Super ausgestattete Arbeitsplätze
  • Kaffee, Getränke, Obst, Kekse, Müsli uvm.
  • ÖPNV-Ticket
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten
  • Respektvoller Umgang im Team

items.content:
Software Engineer, Search Platform

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Education Technology, eLearning, Non-Profit
Company size: 201–500 people
Company: Wikimedia Foundation, Inc. | No office location

Technologies

java
php
machine-learning

Job description

Summary

Our small team is passionate about making knowledge discoverable. We are responsible for Wikidata Query Service (a graph database that allows users to run arbitrary SPARQL queries on Wikidata) and for the search engine used on Wikipedia and its sister projects.

We are looking for a software engineer to help us bring the Search Platform team to the next level.

We use open-source tools as much as possible, and always open source our own work. Java, Python, PHP, and Scala make up most of our code, but we value using the right tool for the job. Our world is vast and can be complicated, so we value communication, enthusiasm, and an eagerness to learn.

You are responsible for:

  • Work and communicate clearly and effectively within a small team that spans multiple time zones
  • Help maintain, scale, and extend query services at the Wikimedia Foundation — this includes the Wikidata Query Service (WDQS) and our Elasticsearch-based search engine
  • Improve the integration of Search, Wikidata Query Service, and the MediaWiki platform

Skills and Experience:

  • Good working knowledge of software design principles
  • Good understanding of how to scale applications, in terms of load, complexity, and performance
  • Ability to work in a Linux server environment
  • Write code in Java and PHP that stands the test of time
  • Demonstrated experience in large-scale Java applications
  • Be willing to travel occasionally - sometimes internationally - for team and organizational meetings
  • Proficient English speaker

Additionally, we’d love it if you have:

  • Degree in computer science, statistics, math, physics or other quantitative discipline; equivalent experience learned hands-on on the job also works
  • Experience with graph databases
  • Experience working on open source, collaborative development projects
  • Understanding of free culture / free software / open source principles
  • Exposure to applied machine learning (ML), deep learning, or natural language processing (NLP)
  • Familiarity with statistics
  • Experience with an internet software environment operating at scale; for example, messaging platforms that process hundreds of thousands of events per second
  • Big thumbs ups if you are a contributor to Wikipedia

Show us your stuff! If you have any existing open-source software that you've developed (this could be your own software or patches to other packages), please share the URLs for the source. Links to GitHub, etc. are especially useful.  

U.S. Benefits & Perks*

  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
  • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more
  • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
  • Flexible and generous time off - vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays - including the last week of the year.
  • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
  • For those emergency moments - long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
  • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
  • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
  • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
  • Great colleagues - diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

*Eligible international workers' benefits are specific to their location and dependent on their employer of record

More information

WMF
Blog
Wikimedia 2030
Wikimedia Medium Term Plan
Diversity and inclusion information for Wikimedia workers, by the numbers
Wikimania 2019
Annual Report - 2017

Apply now

About Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.

The Wikimedia Foundation is...

...the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.

Benefits

  • Fully paid premiums for medical, dental & vision insurance premiums
  • 401(k) with 4% matching contribution
  • 7-12 weeks parental leave with 100% pay + lactation room
  • Wellness Program ($1800 annual) to promote wellness & personal growth
  • Pre-tax savings plans for Transportation & Parking
  • Flexible work schedules and remote working options
  • Pet Friendly office
  • Commitment to diversity & inclusion throughout the employee lifecycle
  • 12 days vacation, 19 days holiday, 2 days volunteer work and more!
  • Lean more at https://wikimediafoundation.org/wiki/Work_with_us

items.content:
Remote Full-Stack Ninja Developer Remote Software Developer - for a Fast-Paced Fun-Loving Start-Up
Do you get excited about technology, gadgets and the next big thing? ?
Is coding about doing something you love; not just a day job? ?

Do unsolved problems keep you up at night?
If you are looking for a fast paced environment building something that impacts millions of people and billions of dollars then you?ll fit in with the research and development team at NinjaCat! ?Our goal is to deliver high quality software that meets the real world needs and exceeds our customers? expectations.
As a Software Developer your mandate is to:
  • Create features that delivers on usability, performance and software craftsmanship.
  • Work through business and technology problems with a tight knit team - we collaborate on ideas starting from a random thought to a full blow feature.
  • Think on your feet about solutions to problems.
  • Enjoys the flexibility of working from home and at startup speed. This is not a 9-5 job.
  • Understand the customers come first. We ship often and work closely with customers to get it right.
We believe that everyone should be a voice within the team; the best products come from collaboration and independent thinking and we want your voice. ?You don?t have to worry about tools ? if you need it; you?ll get it.?
We need ninjas with a passion for web technology who provides expertise and leadership with responsive, interactive web applications. ?
Here at NinjaCat we pay special attention to building relationships in a remote environment - it can't be all about work! We know how to have fun too ? join our movie club, play cards against humanity, fantasy football, and more. ?Last year we did a corporate retreat to Disney World - still one of our most talked about events!?
Skills / Environment:
  • We develop mostly in Laravel (PHP) and Vue.js (TypeScript),?but care more about software engineering concepts than specific language wars.
  • Able to communicate complex ideas in a way that everybody can share your vision
  • We do continuous deployment to production, which means we get early feedback from customers.
  • We write good tests. Not tests for the sake of tests, but tests that help us think out code design and protect ourselves from regression and ultimately move faster.
  • We are agile developers.? Scrum, Kanban, Scrumban - we do what works for us not what's prescribed.?
  • 12/12 on the Joel Test
  • Our tech team is split between United States and Canada from coast to coast.
NinjaCat is a unified marketing analytics platform. The leader in scalable reporting, monitoring, call tracking and data pipelines for agencies and media companies. NinjaCat integrates with all of the popular PPC, Display, SEO, Social Media, Call Tracking and Reputation Channels providing you all the tools you need to automate your reporting, monitor campaigns and budgets, win new clients and trasform existing customers into raving fans. NinjaCat is the reporting platform of choice for the world?s leading agencies.
  • Inc Magazine - Best Place To Work
  • Glassdoor 5 Star Rating
  • Fast growing Inc 500 company
  • You can work for an awesome CEO with smart and supportive teammates.
  • Work-From-Home Flexibility. Need we say more?

  • Unlimited Vacation
  • 401k
  • Health and Dental Insurance
  • No longer grassroots, we have an incredibly bright future ahead.? You will be joining at a critical point in the growth of our company.? The only way is up.
  • Celebrations, fun and laughter always

  • We do continuous deployment to production, which means we get early feedback from customers.

  • We are agile developers.? Scrum, Kanban, Scrumban - we do what works for us not what's prescribed.?

items.content:
Horizon PPM is a next generation Project Portfolio Management system closing the gap between project delivery and executive decision makers.


Following live trials in large corporate environments we have a foundation to support early adopters and now need a full-stack developer to take the lead technical role and potentially CTO.


This role is expected to part-time/equity based for the remaining few months of this year whilst we close our first seed round and onboard the first major clients. During this period the focus will be on hands-on technical development with an option to progress to CTO as the business and team grows.


Tech Stack:



  • PHP Symfony

  • Python Django

  • Javascript/Jquery

  • AWS

  • Ubuntu Linux

  • Mysql

  • Bitbucket / Git


Non-Tech Skills:



  • Communication (this one can't be stressed enough!)

  • Structured & methodical, yet agile & flexible

  • Strong Integrity

  • Innovation & creative problem solving

  • Tenacious

  • Takes ownership

  • Resourceful

  • GSOH


Location: Remote. Plenty of Skype, Trello, Slack, etc. Ideally you'll be commutable to either London or the East Sussex coast for the rare times we want to get together face to face.


Compensation: Equity share for the right person


About Us: Currently more about me! I'm a solo founder with 30 years business experienced - and supported by an advisory team with a further 120 years I can lean on. Well connected in large enterprise environments in the UK and overseas. The next 6-12 months is going to be an adventure as things kick off.


Something Extra: Character and attiude will win the day, so applications welcomed from recent graduates or more mature candidates that may not have all the tech skills just yet but are prepared to put in the time to overcome this and rise to the challenge.


Process: I'm more interested in social media profiles than a CV. Then we'll talk.


Agencies: You'll be wasting your time chasing this one!

items.content:
Senior Software Developer – Bridgend - £28,000 – £33,000

There is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Senior Developer to join my client in Bridgend. They’re in the process of transitioning from a client project based business model to an internal product driven business, which you'll have the opportunity to be at the heart of.

I am looking for a Senior Developer with 3+ years’ relevant experience and the following core skills:
  • HTML/CSS/JS
  • Experience of Object-oriented PHP in a production environment
  • JavaScript framework(s) – Jquery, Angular, React
  • Databases such as MySQL/MSSQL/Postgres
  • Understanding of LAN/WAN
Desirable skills are:
  • Java/Android in a production environment
  • PHP frameworks such as CakePHP, Laravel ect.
  • GIT.SVN software
Why Apply?
  • Brand new offices in a great location, with train station 5 minute walk away.
  • Remote & Flexible working.
  • State of the art infrastructure.
  • Travel to work scheme
  • Competitive Salary
  • Choice of hardware and tech
  • Monthly free lunch club
  • Shower facilities
  • A fun-filled working environment.
  • Exposure to the latest technologies and training in these technologies.
Interviews have started already please apply by Wednesday 14 th to be considered for the role.

If you are a self-motivated individual who is keen to develop existing knowledge whilst being part of a fun growing team give me a ring on 01179107984.

Senior Software Developer – Bridgend - £28,000 – £33,000
Bridgend
Permanent
£28,000 - £33,000 a year

items.content:
We are looking for an experienced, dynamic and collaborative Web Developer that will work closely with the Marketing and IT teams to identify and prioritize opportunities to enhance the pc/nametag website. We are open to this position being either on-site or remote.

Because we recruit the most talented people with proven track records, pc/nametag, Inc. continues to experience unprecedented growth while fostering a culture that values and rewards the high-quality work of each employee. We take great stock in individuals who bring ideas to the table while also working collaboratively toward a well-executed plan, one that turns possibilities into highly successful results.

In this new role you will be responsible for the technical development of the pc/nametag website-providing full cycle project leadership including architecture, database design/programming and Magento development, while building site layouts and UI elements.

At pc/nametag each employee is valued. Customer service is not only vital to keeping our customers happy, but for our employees as well. We enjoy a variety of soft perks, some of our favorites are weekly catered lunches, the yearly UW Badger football game and the variety of holiday celebrations like Mardi Gras and Halloween - all while working together to successfully grow pc/nametag®.

Responsibilities:
  • • Identify technical needs and gather specifications and requirements for efficient updates
  • • Write documented, quality code using best development practices that can undergo extensive testing
  • • Responsible for deploying, maintaining, and scaling the pc/nametag website
  • • Integrate data from SQL databases and other back-end services.
  • • Keep up with industry trends and apply them into operations and activities when necessary

Requirements:
  • • Associates degree in Computer Science, MIS, related field; or 5 years of equivalent work experience
  • • Minimum of 3 to 5 years of PHP experience
  • • 7 years of web development experience
  • • Strong grasp of git version control
  • • Experience with running applications in a continuous integration environment
  • • Regression and unit testing with PHPUnit
  • • Familiarity with developing and consuming REST and SOAP APIs
  • • Must be comfortable working on complex Linux systems for administration and debugging as needed
  • • Ability to convert business needs into implemented features
  • • Analyze, design, code, debug, test, document, deploy and provide ongoing support for web applications, owning the entire feature-request to deployment pipeline.
  • • Experience administering LAMP-stack applications in a highly-available cluster.

What we offer:

pc/nametag® operates within the Avery® North America division of CCL Industries Inc., a world leader in specialty label and packaging solutions for global corporations, small businesses and consumers. Here in Verona, WI, we feature the best of both worlds-the culture of a 80-employee community backed by the strength and success of a growing global network. Our employees are our greatest asset, and we make sure they know it. We offer:
  • • Excellent compensation commensurate with experience
  • • Comprehensive benefit package including 401K, health, dental and more
  • • Mid-sized company culture that values individual contribution
  • • Many "soft perks" such as catered lunches during our busy season, outings, free DVD/Blu-ray library, etc.
To learn more about our company, visit our website at . Please email your resume to . Please reference Web Developer in the subject line. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and provide a drug-free workplace.

items.title: Full Stack Drupal Developer (US-based telecommute position) - Alpharetta
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=53, embedded=0, frontend=19}
items.content:
About Us

Mediacurrent is a digital agency that specializes its focus and outstanding reputation in Drupal. We have a proven track record of helping some of the most recognizable brands (The Weather Channel, WWE), universities (Harvard, LSU) and organizations (Turner) in the world adopt and grow with an open-source software strategy. We pursue open-source principles and contributing back to the Drupal community giving you an opportunity to challenge and stretch your mind on a daily basis.

We're a company founded on building a close knit company culture with a fully remote team. Mediacurrent keeps our remote team close focusing on our culture with an annual company retreat, weekly knowledge shares, 9/80 flexible schedule, lunch and learns and virtual/in-person meetups.

At Mediacurrent we invest heavily in our team providing benefits such as IRA matching, continuing education reimbursement and speaking bonuses.

About You

Do you have a passion for open source technologies, Drupal and building innovative web systems? Do you see the big picture of a Drupal project? Ready to ditch the commute and work from wherever is comfortable to you? Mediacurrent is looking for a developer like yourself to choose our team.

Qualifications

  • Ability to write and contribute modules to creatively solve client problems
  • Proficient writing skills to communicate with clients including site architecture documentation
  • Proven 2+ year track record of working with Drupal sites
  • Familiarity with Git and Drupal development technologies such as Drush, Features and Panels
  • Knowledge of Drupal-adjunct technologies such as the LAMP platform, HTML5, CSS3, SASS jQuery/JavaScript a plus
  • Passionate about Drupal community involvement and open-source

    • This is a telecommute position.

    Equal Employment Opportunity

    Mediacurrent provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Mediacurrent complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates or?employees reside. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

items.title: Software Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=9, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=14, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=18, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
Software Engineer

is a fast-growing online-only flower delivery service with a competitive edge. Since launching in 2014, we have become an iconic European flower brand with our innovative business model. Our Amsterdam HQ is home to a diverse team of 80+ high-tech and highly-creative people and growing. 

We're looking for a driven Medior Software Engineer to join us. As part of bloomon’s Product and Engineering team, you’ll build the software that powers our business. From scaling up our subscription platform to meet a 10x increase in volume and complexity to forecasting the number of Paradisaeidae needed for next month’s delivery — you’d be surprised at the amount of tech in flowers!

What you can expect

  • Your focus is to shape our technical platform and engineering culture as we grow
  • Capitalising on opportunities that increase reliability, performance, and real-life efficiency.
  • Structure and a tight schedule suit you, but you’re happy to step outside the box to solve operational problems.
  • Diligence about improving the codebase
  • Working in a team to find the best trade-offs between quality, speed, and scope.
  • Working across a variety of projects, including daily operations, improving the product, innovating the core subscription platform and algorithms
  • Balancing creative engineering with high quality and a customer focus
  • Enhancing the processes that make an effective team: writing good tests, giving and receiving code reviews, writing clear documentation, holding retrospectives, etc.
  • Working alongside other developers, product designers, product owners and a broader team of supply chain experts, brand creatives and stylists

About you 

  • A Bachelor Degree or higher in Computer Science or a related technical field
  • At least 3 years’ professional experience in software development
  • Strong experience in at least 1 programming/scripting languages like PHP, Python, Ruby, Javascript…
  • Experienced with (relational) databases like Postgresql and MySQL
  • You’re experienced in working in an agile environment
  • You have good communication skills and are a team player
  • Familiarity with DevOps
  • Experience with part of our current tech stack: 
    • PHP, Laravel
    • React, Node.js
    • Python, Pandas
    • Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Docker
  • You live in the Netherlands
  • Fluent in English. Dutch is a bonus

What we offer

  • A high level of responsibility, autonomy, and level of impact from day one
  • A competitive package and regular compensation reviews — we reward great work!
  • Annual allowance for personal development
  • Modern work culture: no-meeting Wednesdays, flexibility to work from home, etc.
  • Daily buffet lunch, team events and parties on our roof terrace, gym discount, mobile allowance, amazing free flowers and more.

Apply now

items.content:
Senior Software Engineer

is a fast-growing online-only flower delivery service with a competitive edge. Since launching in 2014, we have become an iconic European flower brand with 110k+ customers with our innovative business model. Our Amsterdam HQ is home to a diverse team of 80+ high-tech and highly-creative people and growing. 

We're looking for a Senior Software Engineer. As part of bloomon’s Product and Engineering team, you’ll build the software that powers our business. From scaling up our subscription platform to meet a 10x increase in volume and complexity to forecasting the number of Paradisaeidae needed for next month’s delivery — you’ll be surprised at the amount of tech in flowers!

What you can expect

  • Shaping our technical platform and engineering culture as we grow
  • Prioritising expertly, communicating clearly, and consistently delivering excellent software engineering skills
  • Juggling multiple responsibilities simultaneously and working across a variety of projects, such as the demands of daily operations, improving the product, innovating the core subscription platform and algorithms, which include order generation, delivery management, invoicing, forecasting, customer data and analytics. 
  • Capability in strong analytics creating innovative operational solutions.
  • Brainstorming with the team to find the best trade-offs between quality, speed, and scope
  • Diligence about improving the codebase
  • Balancing creative engineering with high quality and a customer focus
  • Enhancing working habits and processes that make an effective team: writing good tests, code reviews, writing clear documentation, holding retrospectives, etc
  • Working alongside other developers, product designers, product owners and a broader team of supply chain experts, brand creatives and stylist.

About you 

  • A Bachelor Degree or higher in Computer Science or a related technical field
  • At least 5 years’ professional experience in software development
  • Fluent in 1 or more programming/scripting languages like PHP, Python, Ruby, Javascript…
  • Strong experience with (relational) databases like Postgresql and MySQL
  • Experience of working in an agile environment is a must. Experience in scaling up startups is a bonus.
  • You are an expert in communicating effectively and translating requirements into well-designed technical solutions. 
  • Experience working with large and complex systems
  • Experience with DevOps
  • Experience with part of our current tech stack: 
    • PHP, Laravel
    • React, Node.js
    • Python, Pandas
    • Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Docker
  • You live in the Netherlands/EU
  • Fluent in English. Dutch is a bonus

What we offer

  • A high level of responsibility, autonomy, and level of impact from day one
  • A competitive package and regular compensation reviews — we reward great work!
  • Annual allowance for personal development
  • Modern work culture: no-meeting Wednesdays, flexibility to work from home, etc.
  • Mobile allowance, daily buffet lunch, team events, parties on the roof terrace, gym discount, free flowers and more.

Apply now

items.content:
Senior Full-Stack Developer (JS - Vue.js, PHP - Laravel)

Company: TTEC
Location: Remote
Job type: Full-time
Skills:
  • #laravel
  • #vuejs
  • Accessibility
  • PHP

    • Company description

    Senior Full-stack Developer (JS - Vue.js & PHP - Laravel)

    Job description

    Senior Full-stack Developer (JS - Vue.js & PHP - Laravel)

    ttec, formerly Teletech, is seeking a Sr. Full-stack Developer to join our Product Engineering. This is a nationwide, telecommuting opportunity.

    Why choose TTEC to enhance and broaden your career? We are just as passionate about providing ideal solutions to solving our client’s business problems by driving customer experience outcomes with our enhanced technical capabilities, as you are. Whether you’re the Engineer, Architect, Account Manager, Practice Leader or Sales Executive we need your talent to help us in our exciting journey to success!

    What you’ll be doing:

    As part of our Product Engineering team, you will be a valuable contributor within our icApps group as a Sr. Full-stack Developer. You will work directly with and along side our lead developer and team to identify the design needs of new or modified application features. The Sr. Full-stack Developer will have a seat at the table in all meetings such as project planning, estimation, stand-ups, and stakeholder show & tell.

    • Participate in active discussions regarding new features for future projects.
    • Contribute to the Architecture/Design framework.
    • Help troubleshoot and verify bugs.

    Portal NG Stack

    • Laravel 5.8 - RESTful API
    • Testing: PHPUnit
    • Authentication: Custom, oAuth (Laravel Passport) & JSON Web Tokens
    • Requests: Guzzle
    • Linter/Fixer: php-cs-fixer
    • Vue.js 2.6 - Single Page Application (SPA)
    • Testing: Jest (& expect)
    • Bundler: Webpack
    • Compiler: Babel
    • Styling: Component driven SCSS (using Bootstrap grid)
    • Router: Vue-Router
    • Store: Vuex
    • Request: Axios/Fetch
    • Linter: ESlint
    • Fixer: Prettier
    • Envoy & Bash Scripts - Zero downtime deployment strategy
    • Laravel Dusk - E2E testing framework built on top of ChromeDriver

    What skills you’ll need:

    • 7+ year’s software development experience of web-based applications.
    • The desire to learn while perfecting your craft of designing, building and maintaining enterprise applications.
    • Deep understanding, knowledge and/or experience with most if not all of the following:
    • Test Driven Development (TDD) - preferably using Jest (or Mocha/Jasmine) and PHPUnit
    • Modern Web Languages - HTML, CSS/SCSS, JavaScript/ECMAScript 2015+ (ES6+)
    • JS Frameworks - Vue (or Angular/React)
    • JavaScript build tools - Babel, Webpack, etc.
    • Vue libraries/plugins - vue-test-utils, vue-router, vuex, vue-cli
    • Single Page Applications (SPAs)
    • MVC frameworks - Laravel
    • PHP - all common language features for versions 7.1+
    • Laravel - All features including queues, broadcasting/web sockets (Laravel Echo), Active Record (eloquent), middleware, service providers, database migrations, etc.
    • RESTful APIs
    • API (session-less) authentication - oAuth, JSON Web Tokens, etc
    • Commonly used software design patterns and principles - SOLID, DRY, etc
    • Relational databases, design & best practices - MySQL, PostgreSQL or SQL Server
    • Software development lifecycle - Agile & SCRUM
    • Web Servers - Nginx, Apache, etc
    • Linux Environments - Redhat, CentOS, Ubuntu, etc
    • Experience create accessible and compliant (Section 508 & WCAG A, AA & AAA standards)
    • Ability to do some front-end design allowing for an interactive, accessible and clean UI and UX.
    • Experienced using Test Driven Development (TDD) to produce high-quality, clean code.
    • Some NoSQL database experience and/or knowledge
    • Proficient with SQL and relational database concepts.
    • Highly motivated self-starter with strong attention to detail and proven ability to prioritize and scope work.
    • Excellent logic, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills.
    • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
    • Ability to work effectively with diverse groups of people.
    • Flexibility to handle demands of a rapidly growing and changing workplace.
    • BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience.

    Who We Are:

    TTEC is a pioneer in customer experience, engagement and growth solutions. Our 40,000+ employees serve customers in more than 80 countries and 50 languages across social, mobile, and digital channels. We utilize a holistic approach, applying solutions from our four customer experience segments—Consulting, Technology, Care and Growth—to help companies provide an amazing experience to their customers, inspire customer loyalty, and grow their business. Our employees live by a set of customer-focused values that guide relationships with clients, their customers and each other.

    What We Offer:

    • Variable incentive bonus plan, 401K company match, tuition reimbursement
    • Global career mobility, employee recognition programs, professional development
    • State of the art technology which allows for seamless global connectivity
    • Rich wellness program and health incentives
    Apply now!

items.title: Fullstack Engineer (Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=6, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=13, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
The Accountancy Cloud are on a mission to reinvent accounting. We offer a unique AI-backed accounting, tax and payroll platform that works like a virtual accountant.

With an amazing team of award winning staff having amassed 7 awards in the past 2 years, we are underpinned with values and people that "dare to do the impossible". We have strong collaboration across the entire team which has proved successful to date with the first employee still with us during the 5 years we've been growing.

Now, we have ambitions to scale our platform and therefore we’re looking for passionate and talented Full Stack Engineers to join us on this journey, fully remote.

Your Responsibilities

  • To build exciting new features in both a back-end and front-end capacity such as our marketplace and SaaS subscription services; and make our platform serve international markets such as the USA; conversational chat-bots as well as various machine learning driven cashflow forecasting tools.

  • To contribute to the future direction and architecture of the product under the guidance of our technical leadership, with the potential to become a leader of the future.

  • To provide a level of business-as-usual support on ongoing platform needs across the business when required.

We’d love you to apply, if

  • You’re a continuous improver, not afraid to take risks, try new things and learn from your mistakes.

  • You are curious and passionate about what you do, you take things apart to learn how they work looking constantly for opportunities to improve.

  • You are more than proficient with PHP and JavaScript, with a penchant for tools and frameworks for Laravel and Vue.js - and have other skills you want to bring to the table.

  • You’re more than just a coder, you think through problems, help clarify requirements and really think about the customer and product first.

  • You know what S.O.L.I.D principles and the ways of the 12-factor app are, and have applied them on real-world projects.

  • You are a systems thinker and a problem solver, you have great instincts and can troubleshooting on unfamiliar projects.

Nice to haves

  • Experience of consuming and building RESTful API’s within the Financial Services space, e.g Xero, QuickBooks, Open Banking etc.

  • Experience developing against, and with, Amazon Web Services.

  • A desire to get involved with AI/Machine Learning and making smarter tools for SME’s

Benefits

  • Flexibility: You can manage your own time, there’s no clock-watching, it’s all about positive outcomes.

  • Culture: A super supportive team, psychological safety and a real desire to develop intrapreneurship within our staff.

  • Founders Programme: Massive development potential to be part of our ‘future founders programme’ was designed to invest in skills with plans and lots of support for your career to flourish.

  • Remote: This role can be fully remote, or in the London office - as long as collaboration, communication and outcomes are met - you control your destiny.

  • Rewards: All the usual suspects including 30 days holiday along with a company pension, a share incentive scheme, corporate discounts, socials and a fun ambitious team.

Location

Your home office? In all seriousness, this role can be fully remote but for times where you want to come to the HQ, we're 10 minutes walk from Old Street underground station in London.

items.title: Web Developer & Data (Intern)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=20, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
InnovateFromZero.com has a place for a Web Developer (part-time) with working knowledge of Wordpress CMS to develop new skills in web development, design optimisation, data-analytics & technical SEO. As a winner of multiple innovation awards, we help turn great concepts into great products for our clients and often build multiple landing pages as a part of the process.


InnovateFromZero was founded with a vision to help execute product development projects in web, mobile, and IoT. Amongst the founding partners are successful innovators from ex-Nokia, Google, etc.


The position is suited to students or recent graduates who want work experience in Web Development, enjoys designing landing pages, understands SEO and wants to learn more about data-driven development. You want to hone your skills in optimising Wordpress sites, learning about SEO and using Analytics for digital campaigns.


About You: You are self-motivated, likes clean code and want a fast-paced startup experience.


Your Role (needed): • Graduated or due to graduate with a degree in Engineering, IT or IT related subjects or demonstrated professional Development experience. • Wordpress development skills are mandatory


You will assist with:



  • Identify, troubleshoot, fix, and optimize websites for performance

  • Analyze reports to identify trends, issues, areas for opportunity and create actionable plans to improve KPI’s (with support from the team).


BONUS:



  • Good understanding of search performance, conversion, and online data analysis

  • Experience with Wordpress Yoast SEO plug-in

  • Some knowledge of Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and Google Search Console

  • Excellent HTML, CSS, and JavaScript skills


Data Skills:



  • Data analytics related skills incl use of Kaggle data-sets or kernels

  • Review, update and create high-quality datasets

  • Kernels and tutorials to showcase new features

  • Help onboard client or external partner data-sets

  • Ability to work with messy data and clean, munge, and wrangle it into standard formats using Python or R


Experience working with Data Analytics is not mandatory, but you are a quick learner who can pick up the basics. 


Your Role (preferred): • Some examples of former projects at school/ Uni where you built websites • While some skills can be learned at the job, healthy interest in technology, innovation is useful.


You must have a passion for web development.


To Apply: Send CV/ Letter and tell us why this is right for you! If you have an example of an SEO-optimised website performing well on speed test parameters, etc. you executed in work or uni (is a plus).


If selected you will be based out of our Glasgow city center office in a fantastic co-working environment (2-3 day a week internship, how often you like to come in is flexible, remote work will be OK in some cases).

About You: You are self-motivated, likes clean code and want a fast-paced startup experience.


Your Role (needed): • Graduated or due to graduate with a degree in Engineering, IT or IT related subjects or demonstrated professional Development experience. • Wordpress development skills are mandatory


You will assist with:



  • Identify, troubleshoot, fix, and optimize websites for performance

  • Analyze reports to identify trends, issues, areas for opportunity and create actionable plans to improve KPI’s (with support from the team).


BONUS:



  • Good understanding of search performance, conversion, and online data analysis

  • Experience with Wordpress Yoast SEO plug-in

  • Some knowledge of Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and Google Search Console

  • Excellent HTML, CSS, and JavaScript skills


Your Role (preferred): • Some examples of former projects at school/ Uni where you built websites • While some skills can be learned at the job, healthy interest in technology, innovation is useful.


You must have a passion for web development.


To Apply: Send CV/ Letter and tell us why this is right for you! If you have an example of an SEO-optimised website performing well on speed test parameters, etc. you executed in work or uni (is a plus).


If selected you will be based out of our Glasgow city center office in a fantastic co-working environment (2-3 day a week internship, how often you like to come in is flexible, remote work will be OK in some cases).

items.title: Senior Backend Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=29, embedded=0, frontend=14}
items.content:
Senior Backend Engineer

Deeply rooted in all of us are reasons for Why we make the decisions we do. At PracticeGenius we equip thousands of businesses around the globe with tools and services that more effectively engage and align their business goals and initiatives with those of their customers, advocates, and employees. 

By combining the principles of behavioral economics and choice architecture with gamification, reward-loyalty systems, and social engagement functionality we’ve created a scalable platform that helps businesses of all sizes add contextual interactions and incentives to their most valued relationships.

Accomplishing this takes a focused effort from a talented team. Culturally we pride ourselves on the diversity that is celebrated amongst our teams and share an affinity for intelligent minds, quality work, and exceptional customer care. We have employees distributed throughout the US and offer a remote-friendly culture and flexible in-office positions.

Overview

As a Software Engineer at PracticeGenius, you’ll have a significant impact on a product used by millions of users as well as the team behind it. You’ll do this through a combination of writing code, participating in code review, collaborating remotely with engineering and non-engineering team members, and most importantly contributing your own unique experiences and perspective.

Over the last several years we've made significant strides towards improving our tech stack and engineering culture. We are committed to this as a continual journey. Some technologies you'll be working with are: Laravel (primarily JSON REST APIs), MySQL, Elasticsearch, Javascript, React/Redux, webpack, CI (continuous integration), automated testing on both frontend and backend code, automated deployments, AWS, and more.

Join us as we develop fresh new product offerings as well as help drive our continued mission of improving and replacing legacy systems, constantly adopting new technologies in an environment where you are empowered to experiment and free to fail safely.

Who Are You?

  • You care about product, think about end users, and take pride in the quality of your work.
  • Introvert or extrovert, you've got a phenomenal personality and respect for others.
  • You enjoy the constant challenges and learning that come with software development.
  • You’re not afraid to raise concerns, suggest improvements, or question the status quo.
  • You seek to learn from others as well as share your own knowledge and experience.
  • You’re a good and curious person looking to be a big part of a small team.

What Are Your Skills?

  • You are proficient in PHP (Laravel experience is a plus).
  • You are experienced and confident in managing MySQL in production.
  • You communicate effectively whether on video/audio calls or in a chat environment.
  • You can analyze a problem and break it down into small, achievable chunks.
  • You can act on feedback from others and provide helpful feedback to others.
  • You know how to contribute to and work effectively on a distributed, remote team.
  • You know how to research, explore and successfully introduce new technologies.

Examples of profiles that are relevant to us

*You’ve likely had experience that falls into one or more scenarios such as:

  • Led or played a major role in the development of a system involving multiple software developers and/or teams.
  • Held significant ownership of a software project from its early stages, through initial development, to release and maintenance.
  • Revitalized and/or replaced a legacy system with more modern, appropriate technology.
  • Built a sizable authenticated (e.g. OAuth, JWT, etc) RESTful API-based system.
  • Deployed and maintained a load balanced server environment with multiple web-servers.
  • Introduced or owned backend technologies such as ElasticSearch, Memcached, Redis, RabbitMQ, etc.
  • Identified and optimized performance issues on demanding processes, whether they were database or application code oriented.

Compensation and Benefits

  • We offer competitive salaries.
  • We offer several health benefit plans and a company funded FSA.
  • New iMac or Macbook Pro of your choice, monitors, stand up desk, and more…
  • Paid subscriptions/software to help you grow and excel (PhpStorm, Laracasts, egghead.io, Amazon books, etc...)
  • Ample paid time off, flexible work schedule, and a healthy work-life balance.
  • Remote-friendly. Our engineering team is fully distributed across the Western US. USA candidates only please.

We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender, age, and race. If you are unsure whether you meet the requirements or have any questions, please reach out and we'd be happy to help!

Well...if this all sounds good to you and you think we might have a fit, please proceed!

Apply now

items.title: Junior WordPress Plugin Developer - UpdraftPlus - Cardiff
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=30, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
UpdraftPlus is Hiring! UpdraftPlus is the world’s most trusted WordPress backup, restore and clone plugin and we are looking for a Junior WordPress Developer to join our growing team.

Our products rely on an amazing user experience and good feedback, which means we need to make sure our plugins and websites are developed and maintained to a very high level. The right candidate will be detail oriented with a passion for helping to create high quality products. This is an opportunity to contribute to popular products used by millions of real users around the world.

This is a permanent position to help develop changes across our catalogue of products and websites. Employment or freelance candidates are both welcome to apply.

Although we do have remote developers, we require this new candidate to work from our office in Cardiff, Wales, UK.

Pay is competitive and will depend on your experience.

What you'll be doing:

  • Working on changes and new features for our catalogue of plugins that will be used be real users around the world
  • Working on changes and new features for our plugin's websites
  • Testing changes to our websites and plugins completed by other developers before they get merged and launched
  • Not just following orders but also thinking outside of the box and trying to break new releases and websites changes to find problems

What we're looking for:

  • PHP – you’d be coding UpdraftPlus or WP Optimize, plus fragments for managing the website, plus UpdraftCentral
  • WordPress plugin development – ideally you’ll have a bit of experience of this, but if not a willingness to learn
  • JavaScript (nice but not necessary) – a smaller part of UpdraftPlus, but much bigger part of UpdraftCentral.
  • GitHub / GitLab / Git – nice to have, but can be learnt quickly by good developers used to alternatives like SVN.
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Happy to learn new tools and technologies to help complete tasks
  • Comfortable managing your own time (we don't micro-manage!) to make sure tasks are completed within good time.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £20,000.00 to £24,000.00 /year

Experience:

  • WordPress: 1 year (Preferred)

Location:

  • Cardiff, Cardiff (Required)
Cardiff
Permanent
£20,000 - £24,000 a year

items.content:
Software Developer at Avaaz

Remote | International

Location: Anywhere

Full-time

Allows Remote

Awesome Developers Wanted To Change the World

Avaaz is changing the world, and we’ll give you the means to change it, too. Our team is a place to exercise your creativity and your leadership, while building never-before-seen tools for one of the world’s top online activism organisations. You can let your imagination run wild figuring out how to grow the platform and tools, improve rapid-iterative processes and integrate new technologies.

  • We are a nimble team working on creating opportunities to bring about the world most people everywhere want — one of justice, peace, and freedom.
  • The work environment is quite unique: whether you’re in the office or working from home, our collaborative culture ensures everyone is heard and treated respectfully, with a strong focus on personal development.
  • Our tech build comprises the latest technologies (cloud computing, distributed systems, big data) using great languages (Python, PHP, JS) with proven and cutting-edge datastores (MySQL, Redshift, MongoDB, Redis, Memcache).
  • At Avaaz, your work will have an impact on a huge scale: we have more than 50 million members, who have taken over 200 million actions, told over 500 million friends about Avaaz campaigns and donated more than $50 million online.
  • Our global and distributed tech team creates beautiful, efficient code that works across browsers, platforms and localisations. It’s backed by developers with a proven track record of designing, building and debugging large web applications.

We’re roaming the world in the search for hard-working developers and senior developers with excellent spoken and written communication in English who are able to adapt and learn, with talents for creativity and abstract thinking. The quest is for people who fit that profile; we know specific skills can always be trained and developed.

Let’s chat — I’m pretty sure you’ll want to join us.

Salary is negotiable and tends to be at the top of the NGO space with generous benefits.

Apply for job
